Uses of Package
uno.anahata.asi.model.tool

Packages that use uno.anahata.asi.model.tool
Package
Description
uno.anahata.asi.model.core
Provides the core, model-agnostic domain model for all conversational AI interactions.
uno.anahata.asi.model.tool
Defines the model-agnostic domain model for the tool (function) calling subsystem.
uno.anahata.asi.model.tool.bad
Provides the domain model for tools that were requested by the model but could not be found.
uno.anahata.asi.model.tool.java
Provides the concrete domain model for tools implemented as Java methods via reflection.
uno.anahata.asi.swing.chat
 
uno.anahata.asi.swing.chat.render
 
uno.anahata.asi.swing.chat.tool
 
uno.anahata.asi.tool
Provides the core framework for defining, managing, and executing local Java tools.
  • Classes in uno.anahata.asi.model.tool used by uno.anahata.asi.model.core
    Class
    Description
    AbstractTool
    The abstract base class for a tool, now generic on its Parameter and Call types.
    AbstractToolCall
    Represents a request to execute a specific tool.
    AbstractToolResponse
    Represents the response of a tool call, designed for deferred execution.
  • Classes in uno.anahata.asi.model.tool used by uno.anahata.asi.model.tool
    Class
    Description
    AbstractTool
    The abstract base class for a tool, now generic on its Parameter and Call types.
    AbstractToolCall
    Represents a request to execute a specific tool.
    AbstractToolkit
    Represents a collection of related tools, parsed from a single Java class.
    AbstractToolParameter
    A rich, self-documenting, abstract representation of a single parameter for a tool method.
    AbstractToolResponse
    Represents the response of a tool call, designed for deferred execution.
    ToolExecutionStatus
    Represents the lifecycle status of a single tool's execution.
    ToolPermission
    Represents the user's interactive, one-time choice for a specific tool invocation within the UI prompt.
    ToolResponseAttachment
